sen.j: 西園寺 公広（さいおんじ きんひろ）は、伊予国の戦国大名。
sen.e: Kinhiro SAIONJI was a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku Period.
Kinhiro SAIONJI was a Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period) in Iyo Province.
sen.cmt: 「伊予国の」→訳漏れのため訳出、戦国大名→統一リストの表記に修正しました。
sen.e: Kinhiro SAIONJI was a Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period) in Iyo Province.
He was a castellan of Kurose-jo Castle.
He was a castellan of Kurose-jo Castle.
He was a castellan of Kurose-jo Castle.

sen.j: 天文 (元号)6年（1537年）、西園寺公宣の子として生まれる。
sen.e: In 1537, he was born as a son of 公宣 SAIONJI.
sen.cmt: 読み方不明：公宣 候補：きんのぶ/きみのぶ
sen.e: In 1537, he was born as a son of Kinnobu SAIONJI.
sen.cmt: 公宣 SAIONJI.→Kinnobu SAIONJIに修正しました。（参考: http://members2.jcom.home.ne.jp/sengokubusyou/saionjikesyou.htm)
sen.e: In 1537, he was born as a son of Kinnobu SAIONJI.

sen.j: もともとは伊予国来住寺で僧籍にあったが、弘治 (日本)2年（1556年）、当主であった西園寺実充の実子公高が戦死したため、永禄8年（1565年）に実充の養嗣子として迎えられて還俗した。
sen.e: Originally, he was a Buddhist monk at Kishi-dera Temple in Iyo Province, in 1556, he was adopted by Sanemitsu SAIONJI, family head because Kintaka, his biological child died in a battle, Kinhiro returned to secular life and became the adopted heir and husband of Nishi-hime Princess, a daughter of Sanemitsu to take over as head of the family.
sen.cmt: 読み方：来住寺 きしでら と訳出しました。 (伊予の国＝愛媛県 来住町（きしちょう）に来住廃寺があることから）
sen.e: Originally, he was a Buddhist monk at Kishi-dera Temple in Iyo Province; however in 1556, because the family head Sanemitsu SAIONJI's biological child, Kintaka died in a battle, Kinhiro became the adopted heir of Sanemitsu and returned to secular life in 1565.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」「永禄8年（1565年）」→訳漏れのため訳出、原文の内容に沿うよう訳し直しました。
sen.e: Originally, he was a Buddhist monk at Kishi-dera Temple in Iyo Province; however in 1556, because the family head Sanemitsu SAIONJI's biological child, Kintaka died in a battle, Kinhiro became the adopted heir of Sanemitsu and returned to secular life in 1565.

sen.j: 実充の娘の西姫の婿になり、家督を継承した。
sen.e: Kinhiro became the husband of Nishi-hime Princess, a daughter of Sanemitsu to take over as head of the family.
Kinhiro became the husband of Nishi-hime Princess, a daughter of Sanemitsu to take over as head of the family.

sen.j: 同年、土佐国の一条兼定を攻める。
sen.e: The same year, he fought against Kanesada ICHIJO.
In the same year, he fought against Kanesada ICHIJO.
sen.cmt: In the same yearとしました。
sen.e: In the same year, he fought against Kanesada ICHIJO.

sen.j: 永禄11年（1568年）には毛利氏、河野氏と手を結んで一条兼定、宇都宮豊綱、津野氏を攻めて勝利した。
sen.e: In 1568, cooperated with the Mori clan and the Kono clan he fought against Kanesada ICHIJO, Toyotsuna UTSUNOMIYA and Yoshishige OTOMO and won.
In 1568, in cooperation with the Mori clan and the Kono clan he fought against Kanesada ICHIJO, Toyotsuna UTSUNOMIYA and the Tsuno clan and won.
sen.cmt: cooperated with→in cooperation withとし、Yoshishige OTOMO→the Tsuno clanに修正しました。
sen.e: In 1568, in cooperation with the Mori clan and the Kono clan he fought against Kanesada ICHIJO, Toyotsuna UTSUNOMIYA and the Tsuno clan and won.

sen.j: 元亀3年（1572年）にも土佐一条氏を攻めたが、逆に一条氏と縁戚関係にあった大友義鎮の攻撃を受けて大敗した。
sen.e: In1572, he fought against the Tosa Ichijo clan, but attacked by Yoshishige OTOMO who was related to Ichijo clan and got hardly defeated.
In 1572, he fought against the Tosa Ichijo clan, but was attacked by Yoshishige OTOMO who was related to the Ichijo clan and suffered a crushing defeat.
sen.cmt: attacked→was attacked、got hardly defeated→suffered a crushing defeat、the Ichijo clanとし、スペース追加しました。
sen.e: In 1572, he fought against the Tosa Ichijo clan, but was attacked by Yoshishige OTOMO who was related to the Ichijo clan and suffered a crushing defeat.

sen.j: 天正12年（1584年）、長宗我部元親の猛攻を受けて降伏し、翌天正13年（1585年）、四国平定を図る豊臣秀吉配下の小早川隆景に攻められて降伏したのである。
sen.e: In 1584, he was attacked by Motochika CHOSOKABE and surrendered, then in 1585, attacked by Takekage KOBAYAKAWA, a retainer of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI who aimed to subjugate Shikoku and surrendered.
In 1584, he was attacked by Motochika CHOSOKABE and surrendered, then in 1585, attacked by Takakage KOBAYAKAWA, a retainer of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI who aimed to subjugate Shikoku and surrendered.
sen.cmt: Takekage KOBAYAKAWA→Takakage KOBAYAKAWAに修正しました。
sen.e: In 1584, he was attacked by Motochika CHOSOKABE and surrendered, then in 1585, attacked by Takakage KOBAYAKAWA, a retainer of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI who aimed to subjugate Shikoku and surrendered.

sen.j: その後は居城の黒瀬城のみを残され、新領主の小早川隆景に属したが、天正15年（1587年）、新たに宇和の領主となった秀吉の家臣・戸田勝隆に戸田邸で謀殺された。
sen.e: After that, only Kurose-jo Castle was left to Kinhiro and he became a retainer of Takekage KOBAYAKAWA but 1587, he was killed by a retainer of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, Katsutaka TODA who was newly assigned as the feudal lord of Uwa Country.

After that, only Kurose-jo Castle was left to Kinhiro and he became a retainer of Takakage KOBAYAKAWA but in 1587, he was killed by a retainer of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, Katsutaka TODA who was newly assigned as the feudal lord of Uwa County.
sen.cmt: Country→County、Takekage KOBAYAKAWA→Takakage KOBAYAKAWA、1587→in 1587に修正しました。
sen.e: After that, only Kurose-jo Castle was left to Kinhiro and he became a retainer of Takakage KOBAYAKAWA but in 1587, he was killed by a retainer of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, Katsutaka TODA who was newly assigned as the feudal lord of Uwa County.
the age at death was 51year old.
He died at the age of 51.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。
sen.e: He died at the age of 51.

sen.j: これにより、大名としての西園寺氏は完全に滅亡した。
sen.e: The death put a complete end to the Saionji clan as a daimyo.
The death put a complete end to the Saionji clan as a daimyo.
The death put a complete end to the Saionji clan as a daimyo.
